website_summaries.verdict: Explore learning concepts through sounds, songs, and instruments. Wide recommended age range of 6 months to 3 years.
pros: Parents who want to introduce their little ones to music early will enjoy the 70+ songs, tunes, and learning responses
Detachable legs help the table grow with your child, going from a flat toy on the ground to the tabletop design
Real sounds of the piano, drum, xylophone, trombone, and guitar
Classics like "Itsy Bitsy Spider" are included in lively versions that won't become annoying too quickly
cons: Some users note that it slides easily, so use caution not to lean on it

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy but not very stable with legs on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 month old granddaughter. She plays with it all the time and squeals and laughs, so I gave it 4 stars for that reason. It slides around and she isn't walking yet, although she is standing, so I put it on the carpet hoping that would keep it from sliding. She still was able to push it over or push it around, which would cause her to fall. I could just take the legs off, but she likes to pull up and stand, so instead I put it between two chairs up against our book shelf, so now it is a more stable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Church

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend keeping in mind that it may slipped if baby ...
customer_reviews.text: Baby will be 10 months in 4 days and she loves it. It is not crazy loud. She stands since she was 7 and just today started walking so! She enjoys walking around it round and round! It is lightweight and she pushes it if she rest her body on it over the carpet so I can imagine it slips much easier on wooden or other floor material. I work long hours and my husband is a stay home dad! And this has been a lifesaver for him! Would definitely recommend keeping in mind that it may slipped if baby pushes it to stand!
customer_reviews.author: Dra.MHC

customer_reviews.title: The winning gift of Christmas.
customer_reviews.text: This was the hit of Christmas. My brother and sister in law also love that when they’re ready to pull their hair out over hearing the ABCs in either Spanish or English, they swap it over to the music side. A total hit, as the photo shows. My adorable nephew, while he’s never in a bad mood, is also the judgiest (sp?) human alive, so for him to be this enthralled says a LOT. He even preferred this to eating tissue paper, which, at 9 months, is a true feat. The teacher in me also feels like the absolute MVP and that I am buying my nephew presents to help mold the next Einstein.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: When first learning to pull up it's not very sturdy, but now that she's a pro she has ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this product. When first learning to pull up it's not very sturdy, but now that she's a pro she has no difficulties. She will play with this for hours if allowed. She loves all sides and will dance along with all the music. She's had it now for about two/three months and she still loves it. (Bought it at about ten months, now she's almost thirteen months)
customer_reviews.author: SAWorley

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. can't go wrong with the price. My daughter is learning to stand on her own and this is the perfect height for her to lean on. She is tall for her age. She loves all of the buttons and sounds. We don't have a ton of plastic light up toys, I would have preferred a wood activity table but they are so expensive. I read lots of reviews and this seemed to be the best and safest. She will be able to play with this has she starts to stand on her own and even after walking. This toy will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, better for more stable standers
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old twins love this thing. They just walk around it playing with all the things on it. Only thing I would caution is it is easy to flip over if your baby holds onto it while falling backwards. It is light enough that it doesn't hurt but it is scary for mom and baby. I always sit close and hold it with my foot with my more wobbly babe.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Gottselig

customer_reviews.title: Fun for babies, not obnoxious for parents to hear
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month girl old loves this thing! And I don’t mind hearing it either. It’s so refreshing that it doesn’t have obnoxious squeaky kid voices talking or singing loudly every time the baby moves something on it. Just fun jazzy music/ drums sounds and other instruments, and a voice that calls out a few numbers of she hits the number keys. That’s it. It’s fun and cute. But it DOES slide around easily because it’s so light weight. So you need to keep it next to a wall so if baby pushes on it and it slides, at least the wall will stop it
customer_reviews.author: Maria Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Not in product box.....just an ugly cardboard box!  Not nice for gifting!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this leap frog table as a gift. I expected it to be in a Leap Frog box, but was very disappointed to find that the cardboard shipping box is the only box this was contained in. So, now I will be wrapping an ugly cardboard box that does not show a lovely picture of the product. While I’m sure the product itself will be fine, this was quite a surprise to me, and a big disappointment! It arrived on time, but really not a proper box for gifting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Main part cute, legs came filthy dirty!
customer_reviews.text: Table top was cute, the legs came sealed in a plastic bag, ripped open the bag and all four legs were filthy! So bummed for the price I expected a clean new item. I tried my best to clean them but the back has parts that are really hard to clean and the dirt coming off was black-see photos. I caved and am returning! Please fix this issue. I was really looking forward to my baby getting to play with this!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: A favorite trusted product!
customer_reviews.text: We had this same table, in a previous version, about 10 years ago for our older children. We bought it for our newer baby for Christmas. It's the same quality toy we loved for our other children. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: The Boos Family

customer_reviews.title: My 18 month old still loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this table for my son when he first started pulling himself up to stand because I hoped it would encourage him to stand. It seemed to. He's been walking and running around for a few months now, and he still loves this table. In fact, he picks it up and carries it around the house! I like that you can set the language to English or Spanish. I'm learning some Spanish when I play with him. LOL. Anyway, I like the table. My son likes the table. I was worried that he'd outgrow it quickly, but that doesn't seem to be the case. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Good but not as good as it once was
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 month old niece after having one for my twins that are now 4 years old. My twins loved theirs and in fairness so did my niece definitely age appreciate however afew things have chanced for the worst: 1: the on/off is now on the top of the unit as is the volume vs. the old way of underneath where the child can’t turn it on themselves or change the volume definitely not an improvement. 2. The legs of the unit don’t securely stay on when snapped in Still a fun toy but getting pretty cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Finnegan

customer_reviews.title: Portable Toy Packs Punch
customer_reviews.text: At first my Little One (LO) didn't really play with this toy. He was barely crawling and I guess he wanted to try and crawl around first. This toy is pretty nice! It has English and Spanish and good volume control. There is so much to do on this little table, it's kinda impressive. Everything you touch makes a sound (if it is turned on) whether its words or music or both, which is nice b/c my LO really responds to music. The legs are easy to assemble/disassemble which makes transporting the toy easy. Now that LO is standing OK this toy is the perfect height and very age appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Patt

customer_reviews.title: Very over stimulating and does not store easily
customer_reviews.text: We bought this thinking that we could take the legs off easily to store it when it wasn’t in use but we weren’t able to take the legs off after we installed them the first time. This table is very dangerous for any baby not able to stand up by themselves— our 7-month twins kept trying to pull themselves to stand on this but it kept falling over. The table is also incredibly stimulating. It sings multiple things at once, and there’s no way a child would benefit from hearing all these random things at once!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Table Legs Don't Work
customer_reviews.text: The babies love this table but sadly 3 of the legs don't lock in place. I bought this item for my twin Godchildren as a gift for Christmas. IF the legs snapped in properly I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Annabella

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was a little heavier or that they maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little heavier or that they maybe put heavier plastic on the bottom of each leg to hold it more steady. My 1 yr old just pushes it across the room because it slides - even on carpet- with the slightest push.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my niece for her birthday and it didn’t work properly... it would work for about 30 seconds and then shut off... even after switching the batteries out numerous times it still had the same defect. I should have contacted the sellers a lot sooner because by now they got rid of it but I was super disappointed it didn’t work as it was supposed to when we gave it to her.
customer_reviews.author: The Bye's

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Good and loud, the perfect present for your sons kids, will drove parents nuts! Which is great.
customer_reviews.author: ALBY

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy. Complaints are the colors on the shapes ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice toy. Complaints are the colors on the shapes match the ones on the keys so when one says yellow, so does the other shape key. Seems like a good way to introduce other colors. Pro, very easy to remove legs to make it a flat/slant board, BUT the legs are sharp with corners. I left the legs which my son loved playing with more than the board but the corners are so sharp, and he's not that coordinated but advanced I was afraid he's injure an eye. They need to round out the edges on the legs make the shapes a different color than the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: Great table but wish it wouldn't slide when leaned on
customer_reviews.text: Love that this table has plenty of entertainment for my son. I appreciate that it includes Spanish as well as a "page" that covers number/letters and another for songs. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 only because it isn't very stationary. My son leans on it and it slides along the floor. It hasn't tipped over or anything though.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: These are hard to find
customer_reviews.text: My first child had this toy 16 years ago and loved it. I had to find one for my new baby. This toy is exactly like I remembered with an added bonus that you can switch the language to Spanish is desired. My son LOVES. It's not overwhelming with stuff so he can focus on each thing on the table. Again these are hard to find and I was shocked I found it at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly B.

customer_reviews.title: 5 month old loves it. So it’s a win!
customer_reviews.text: This is really cute. Right now we don’t have the legs attached and have it sitting on the floor. We place our 5 month old in front of it on a tummy time pillow and rotate it every 5 minutes or so so he can play with each side. He seems to be genuinely entertained and intrigued by it. Anything that holds his attention for more than a few minutes is a great product in our book!
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: We love this table so much that we bought it for ...
customer_reviews.text: We love this table so much that we bought it for a second time for our newest addition to the family. My girls (now 8 & 10 years old) had this table when they were babies/toddlers and absolutely loved it. They both learned to pull themselves up to a standing position because of this table. My 4 month old son is just learning to play with toys and when I hold him up to the table he gets really excited! Table can switch back and forth to just music or words/songs and to English or Spanish.
customer_reviews.author: Alysa

customer_reviews.title: I like that it has a music and a words mode
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old likes to stand and he is starting to be able to support himself on this table. He likes interacting with the things on this toy. I like that it has a music and a words mode, and there are a large variety of sounds. There are also two volume settings. Mine looks a little different from the picture- it doesn't have the orange parts on the side or the blue outlines around the shapes- but it's pretty close otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: natascha

customer_reviews.title: Fun for growing and developing little minds
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old daughter loves this little table. It's the perfect height and she learned to pull up by herself with it. The lights and sounds are kid friendly and fun. I did have to put non slip grips on the bottom because it kept sliding in my hardwood floors but that fixed the issue and it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah June

customer_reviews.title: Great except small flaws!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it! The product looks good - don’t know the quality though since we just got it. The only things I don’t like were 1. When we got it, there were fingerprints everywhere, making the product look dirty and used. But I think the product is new. 2. The legs are VERY hard to remove. Great in general!
customer_reviews.author: Fye

customer_reviews.title: Best to have it
customer_reviews.text: This I brought for my infant who is 11 month old.he really like this table and enjoying it by spending long time on it .it is cute and having cute images on it . highly recommended product.luv to have.
customer_reviews.author: chandan

customer_reviews.title: Hell nah
customer_reviews.text: Some kinda possessed. Freaky noises. Not English or Spanish. Didn’t even fully take out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: mandaleah

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic learning and fun in one.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves it! It has lots of features and sounds and is available in Spanish. It's pretty musical as is, but there's a learning portion that incorporates a friendly voice and once the page is turned on the toy, the fun continues with more musical sounds. This has also helped our baby with standing for periods of time. My only suggestion is to lean it against your couch or something sturdy and safe to prevent sliding if your child isn't a strong walker just yet.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old is working on standing and loves to push the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this!! And it can switch to speak Spanish! We always try to to teach our littles a second language early on plus sign language. This toy is bi-lingual and she loves the music. Caution...1 year old can already climb on top so keep an eye on them.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaGrama

customer_reviews.title: The only thing keeping it from getting a 5 star is sometimes he closes the book part and the blue part on his fingers and he doesn't like that (though he hasn't hurt himself on it)
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old son loves this! He plays with it all day and loves to stand and play with all of the different items. The only thing keeping it from getting a 5 star is sometimes he closes the book part and the blue part on his fingers and he doesn't like that (though he hasn't hurt himself on it). Overall, GREAT value and my son loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha N. Intorre

customer_reviews.title: Good but careful if planning to gift
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is good. However, this was a Christmas gift and the box came uncovered and showing all the product labels and names so the kids saw them and we could no longer give as a gift. This is just and FYI in case you order as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: awesome toy
customer_reviews.text: my 1 year old loves this. MY son had one when he as 1 and it was great so I decided to buy her one and it works like a charm also serves as something sturdy for her to hold on too. She took steps off this toy, my son ironically walk to this toy first when he started walking too. I suggest this toy for all tots learning to walk who like to dance.
customer_reviews.author: S. AGUIAR

customer_reviews.title: Son loves the toy but not at all teething proof
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy! He liked it with and without it’s legs as he has grown. We have purchased two now because the first began not playing music on certain portions. The big issue we have had (with both) is the book has paper stickers that my son has easily “eaten” off during teething. We are certainly hoping the paper wasn’t made with anything toxic. You’d think an age appropriate toy would be teething proof...not even close on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my little boy for Christmas and he loves it! I just wish that it was more to it, like the book in the middle. But other than that, it's a great purchase for a music loving child. Another thing is that it's durable because if he picks it up and drops it, it won't stop playing or break. We only purchase Leapfrog and Vtech toys because my little guy is rough. Great toy for boys
customer_reviews.author: Trey's Angel 83

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Its an amazing musical activity table. I bought it when my daughter was 6months. She used to play the music sitting at one place. Now she can crawl. She stands and plays it. Its a great toy! My baby learned a lot of skills from this. Highly recommend it and it is also of very very good quality and durable.
customer_reviews.author: alokananda k.

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorites
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this table. It helps him stand and cruise around it. We put felt furniture stickers on the bottom so it doesn’t slide around on our rug, but he sometimes uses it as a walker on the tile. It has music mode and learning mode with English or Spanish, and i Find myself singing along sometimes because the songs are fun. Definitely one of the most enjoyable to listen to and most played with noise toys in my house!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: The baby loves it and it's not super annoying, so it's a big win for us
customer_reviews.text: The baby loves it and it's not super annoying, so it's a big win for us! It has two settings for volume, so you can set it lower if it grates your nerves. It was great when he was just learning to stand up and he still uses it sometimes now even though he's starting to walk. I saw that some people said that it slid around too much or that the baby would flip it when they pulled up. We didn't have that problem, but we had it on one of those puzzle piece foam flooring things, so I think that helped with traction.
customer_reviews.author: T. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Such a great toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son at 5 months old. He LOVED it right away and it really helped him with his hand-eye coordination. We used it with the legs off for the first few months, but once he was steady on his feet while pulling up on things, we added the legs. He loves it all the same, one of his favorite toys. It's the first thing he danced to! We haven't had any problems with it so would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Payne

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old grandson LOVES this! He’s just crawling and trying to stand on his own and this is perfect when we’re sitting with him on the floor. He will play forever with it! So many things to keep him busy and engaged. Will definitely buy for friends!
customer_reviews.author: Mellisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Well built and good sounds
customer_reviews.text: The music and notes hold our grandchildren's attention. They also learned songs from it. Children from 6 months to 6 years seem to get some enjoyment from it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 1 year old son's Birthday. He loves it. You can set it to either English or Spanish. It plays different sounds and sings the ABCs. We got it with the frustration free packaging, which was awesome. No fuss and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Y

customer_reviews.title: It works but not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it's extremely light. To baby, it's basically a walker. Plus, it flips over easily. If you take away the legs, it still just moves around way too easily. Without the legs, it appears it's easy for an 11 month baby to flip over and start climbing on it rather than play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eiry

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke after 6 months of normal use. Now it won't play anything on any of the buttons except one sound. Totally unacceptable for a 40 dollar toy. I won't be buying anymore leapfrog toys ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute easy to use. My 10 month old loves it and has for the last two months. helps her stand up by herself now that she is more skilled at it. In the beginning the table would fall before she could stand.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect. My 9 month old daughter loves it as well as my 3 yr old son! Lol I love the educational aspect. Helping my son learn his colors and his abc's. Easily assembled. Also easy to disassemble (by an adult but not by a child) for travel or storage. Lightweight and sturdy. My daughter pulls herself up on it and my son can put all his weight on it.
customer_reviews.author: Matice

customer_reviews.title: Musical stand-up toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my grandsons before they were walking. It’s the perfect height for them to reach, encourages them to stand or reach and challenges their fine motor skills, sensory stimulation, and love for music. They love it!
customer_reviews.author: jo54

customer_reviews.title: Nice but very short
customer_reviews.text: Concept is great. Really cute graphics and fun toys. But so so short. My daughter is on the short side. Just turned 1 and this table is way to small. So if your trying to teach your 4 or 5 month to stand, this is is the perfect height.
customer_reviews.author: KoriS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 1 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for my one year old son. This is my second time purchasing this and once again it has proven its worth. Even my now nine year old remembered his old one and was happy to see this in the house again. It’s super interactive and perfect for little ones just begging to learn the basics.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome interactive toy. Music, ABC's, numbers, lights, 9 mo old grandson loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Grandson is walking around the furniture, and he loves walking around all 4 sides of this for a different interactive experience. Very nice toy. Includes colors, shapes, abc, numbers, little finger buttons. I added a few lil gerber cheese curls to the open compartment for him to find. He LOVED IT.
customer_reviews.author: LadyLuckMD

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy to Grow with your Little One
customer_reviews.text: This table has so much to do for little ones! I LOVE that it can be used with or without legs so younger infants that aren't yet standing can start using it, then as they start to pull up the legs can be added. It's great to have toys that can grow with your child. We loved ours so much we got this for a friend's child for Christmas. It was an immediate hit by her little one too! The activities are easy to use and enticing.
customer_reviews.author: The Taylors

customer_reviews.title: Great Hit
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old grand daughter hasn't stopped playing with this since I gave it to her 3 months ago! And you know it's a great hit when your daughter calls you up to say she had to hide it "outside" last week, because she kept crying to get out of her bed and bang around on it, at 10:00pm on a work night! LOL Paybacks my dear daughter, paybacks. My daughter really does love it, also. there is so many things to do with it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: Loving this little table. Super easy packaging and really easy to put together. (My kind of toy!!) good quality and my 10 month loves it. There are a lot of fun songs and noises that come out of this!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: love this table!
customer_reviews.text: This table was the perfect gift for my 6 month old grandbaby. It is very sturdy to help with his pulling up and was able to hold on and walk around. He is a year old now and is still one of his favorite toys!
customer_reviews.author: tracy crooks

customer_reviews.title: Great educational toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this play table as a Christmas gift for my 8 month old grandson. It was an absolute hit! Once it was opened and set up (only the legs needed snapped in place) he had no interest in anything else. Great selection of nursery rhyme music and has English and Spanish options. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: CPM Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Slides around on the floor but fun stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great for baby to stand and cruise around on. Slips around on hardwood floor so needs to be up against something. Also not sturdy enough for baby to pull up on. But she loves the music and all the activities. Legs are easy enough to put on and remove as needed.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great toy just a little wobbly
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month loves this toy. She has even tried to climb up on it. However it is wobbly like I've read from other reviews so we keep it closer to a wall so that my little one doesn't topple over.
customer_reviews.author: LilBit89

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic toy
customer_reviews.text: I live this little table. I have had one for each of my two kids and always handed them down. I just bought one for my Niece for Christmas. It’s a great toy, It’s bright, colorful, easy for little hands. This was one of my kids favorite toys. It’s always something. I recommend to new parents
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bohm

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toy for teaching to sit upright, stand and have fun at the same ti
customer_reviews.text: This was the first toy my daughter went crazy over. She loves this table! She first played with it at physical therapy and we took two of the legs off for her to lean against to learn sitting and standing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Our first stopped working after 3.5 years. We replaced with the same, but different color due to price. The legs are designed differently and I was unable to remove them once inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Christina B

customer_reviews.title: Best toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best toy ever!! Of all toys I've bought, this one has kept her interested since she was 10 months old and still at 1.7 mnths old. It has where to put snacks, it teaches her patience, it lets me know when she is hungry and I get to use it to gift her for learning things. It is in Spanish and English, also it has either only music or talking. I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these at this point. I gave one to my grandson and donated the other to a children's hospital. The hospital one is used all the time by the kids while they wait for their appointments.
customer_reviews.author: F. Gentner

customer_reviews.title: Began to play with it right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: My Great-Niece was so excited. At 9 months she pulled herself up and immediately began to play with the book. The musical sound is very stimulating, along with bright colors and lights. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: LVA

customer_reviews.title: Great, my daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 month old for Christmas. She absolutely LOVES it. Her favorite toy, it has enough songs and buttons to keep her entertained without getting bored. Shes starting to pull herself up now and uses it to stand- the only downside i find is that its not very sturdy; it moves, and shes fallen over a few times on it but other than that she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the playroom
customer_reviews.text: This really helped our baby with standing. She absolutely loves it. It’s not annoying (a big deal!) and has a variety of sound features. It’s a good buy if your little one is learning to stand!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C.

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Really cute but very light. My son is starting to walk and when he pulls himself up using the table as an anchor it moves a lot and/or flips entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Camryn LaRue

customer_reviews.title: Approved by both me and my daughter!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 9months old and she has loved this table for a while now. It has a music setting and an education setting, two volume settings as well. It’s the perfect height very age appropriate. I also love the color which was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. It’s been helping her walk better since we got it and gain her balance. She loves eating her little snacks in the door on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Not too interesting.
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 month old got sick of it pretty quickly. It's really boring. Not much to do but stand there and press things. She'd rather interact or move around. NEXT!
customer_reviews.author: R. Mahieu

customer_reviews.title: One page book?
customer_reviews.text: Nice activity table, only problem I have is that the book in the middle only has one page to flip. It looks like multiple but only one which makes no sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Rounded corners
customer_reviews.text: I got this and another different brand for my granddaughters. They like it, but they like the other one better, because its more colorful, has more activities and its brighter and she likes it. I wish the colors were brighter.
customer_reviews.author: NCF

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this toy. I would have given ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy. I would have given it 5 stars but it is not very stable. She isn't walking on her own yet and she push or pull this over. We had to place it against a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy baby occupying device / dance party machine
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old child beats up on this toy and somehow it’s still standing strong haha! He’s a big fan of the music and can’t stop dancing when a song plays. Super cute. Keeps him occupied for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P.

customer_reviews.title: Big Hit with our Toddler
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a first birthday present for our toddler, and she loves it! Literally plays with it every single day. It's been great for encouraging her to pull up and stand/work towards balancing on her own and eventually walking. All of the little buttons and pulls also promote the development of her fine motor skills. No safety issues that we've noticed. So, overall, very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Casey T.

customer_reviews.title: Big Hit
customer_reviews.text: My niece loves this so much that my brother was mad that I outdid him. It's very cute in Spanish mode, and the English voice is okay as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. S.

customer_reviews.title: 11 month old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I was really going back and forth and several different activity tables for babies and finally decided upon this one based on another customer's review. They said that this specific table had been loved by all of her children throughout the years. That's the mark of a good baby product imo. Well, my picky 11 month old (picky with toys!) LOVES this. I wasn't sure if she would, but she does. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: eromo99

customer_reviews.title: He is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 10 month old nephew, who loves it, and his father (my brother) loves the educational aspect of it. He tells me it is well thought out. When my nephew presses the red square once, it says "red", twice and it says "square" and three times it says "red square". He is very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Gillyweed

customer_reviews.title: Even the sitters will love this
customer_reviews.text: This is a great development toy. I took two legs off when my son was too small and he would interact with it and play. Now, he can stand up and uses it to stand/sit and play. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: HMH^2 HLH

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gift and not too pricy!
customer_reviews.text: Had this delivered to my 10 month old grandson...he just loves it and it keeps him very busy. Just the right height...his 5 year old sister sits and plays with it with him so there is a lot to play with on this.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: Has been played with since around 6 months on the floor without the legs, still being played with at 14 months with the legs on.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: Really fun for babies under 1! (And probably over 1, too)
customer_reviews.text: Really fun features on this play table, which my son has loved from age 8mo to now at nearly 11mo! There’s a center “book” with a “page” you can flip to totally change the sounds that the table makes. On one page, the buttons on the table mostly play music; on the other page, the buttons play words and sounds. The downside of this table is it doesn’t stay up super well with stronger babies, but I wedged ours in a corner and that has helped :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! My 15 month old loves it! Learned how to navigate it at 14 month she has her favorite sounds lol so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Crissy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for Our 1 Y/O
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect gift for our 1 year old who loves to pull herself up to stand not quite walking, but she can use the table to walk around to play with all the musical instruments on it. Of all the gifts she received for Christmas, this is the one she plays with the most.
customer_reviews.author: JHW-California

customer_reviews.title: Safe and durable
customer_reviews.text: Loved the price and durability. Great for pre- walkers and walkers. My granddaughter pushed it around the house. She stood on it and was safe.
customer_reviews.author: Tina J.

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes it very much for the different buttons and stuff but it slides! She is just learning to stand on her own and uses this toy for support but once she leans on it it slides and has not friction with the floor. I guess because it is too light so I have to watch out or hold it while she plays.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: My 11mo old daughter loves this.
customer_reviews.text: My 11mo old daughter loves this. She likes to put things in the little compartment and dance to the music
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning table
customer_reviews.text: Fun learning table for babies just learning to stand or sitting. My (grandchildren)11 months old, 15 months old and 4 year old all love this activity table.
customer_reviews.author: Ren Pro

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Is a magnet for young children. Babies can crawl over and just touch it anywhere and get a musical response! Great for pre walkers since it allows them to stand up and play with musical keys or play makers ! My grandson loves it !
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My grand baby loves this! Has an english and spanish option, which we toggle between. We've placed it directly on the floor without the legs and now use the legs, which are very sturdy. The sound and colors and awesome and there are no flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: Great learning experience!
customer_reviews.text: The Leap Frog Musical table was a Christmas present for my then 10 month granddaughter. At the time she was standing and taking steps so she could use it at full height. It keeps her interest and has encouraged the walking process. She is tuned into music and noise so this toy has met the goal. We will continue to evaluate as a learning tool. The table and all it’s moving parts have held up beautifully so far.
customer_reviews.author: DOVE

customer_reviews.title: Soft plastic, entertaining and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for a baby that is scaling furniture. It is sturdy, soft, durable plastic with not sharp areas and entertaining! My 10 month old grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great learning baby station
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves it! Gave it for Christmas, and I'm still getting videos from my sister all the time of her baby playing with this and laughing
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Molski

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Very entertaining and great quality. It doesn’t look and feel cheap and I like that the toys are a different style than the same toys. Very happy with this
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Great for music loving kid
customer_reviews.text: This is a great age appropriate toy. Our son loves music and this has become the center of his play area. He gets such a kick out of the different instruments and sounds. Only reason I wouldn’t give it fives stars for giftable is that the noises are repetitive and I’d want to check with the parents your giving it to. Also very durable. Our son bangs on it and pushes it around the floor. It holds up well!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: The product was fine but the packing was seriously lacking inspection before shipping
customer_reviews.text: The item in itself is ok. But what wasn’t on was unpacking it and having a hand full of tiny dogfood pieces falling out of it. BIG NONO!!! With a child crawling around the floor there should be no little pieces of anything falling out of a toy/box that comes out of a box that has no damage whatsoever. Very dissatisfied with that.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids interested
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this at 12 months old she is, 16 months now and still loves it. Has spanish and English modes. Learning and music modes. Perfect for a child to learn how to pull themselves up on. Or play on the floor with if younger, just don't put legs on if floor playing.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Bailey

customer_reviews.title: I think it is a great toy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson who had just learned to stand. I believe this toy helps to strengthen little legs that will soon be walking. Held his interest fairly well. Once he started walking he used this toy to walk to and hold on until he was ready to walk with confidence. Actually bought another one for grandson #2 who is not yet a year old. I think it is a great toy.
customer_reviews.author: dsnygrlbks

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble. My baby loves this toy! We've also found that you can take 2 legs off and prop it up that way for baby to play with and pull up on!
customer_reviews.author: JEN DINGLE

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Engaging
customer_reviews.text: Great toy to keep baby engaged. Love the sounds and action. Wish the volume was a tad bit lower though. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MSmith

product_meta.title: LeapFrog Learn and Groove Musical Table (Frustration Free Packaging), Green (80-19270E)
product_meta.description: Color:Green| Product Packaging:Frustration-Free PackagingLeapfrog and Amazon.Com have teamed up to offer this item in Amazon frustration-free packaging; a recyclable, easy-to-open alternative to traditional packaging. Turn up the sounds of learning fun with the learn & groove musical table! children can choose between dance and discovery with a music mode that introduces songs and sounds of instruments, and a learning mode that teaches basic shapes, colors and more. Press, slide, pull and spin colorful instruments and shapes to activate a variety of learning responses. Flip the page in the "book" to switch between learning mode and music mode. Press any button in learning mode to explore the alphabet, colors, shapes, numbers and opposites. Flip to music mode and learn popular songs, tunes and real instrument sounds of the piano, drum, xylophone, trombone and guitar. Children can stand play or explore on the floor as they dance and sing along to classic children's tunes, including the "ABC song," "old MacDonald," "pop goes the weasel," "Itsy Bitsy spider" and more. A language selector gives the option of bilingual play in either English or Spanish. This frustration-free package comes without excess packaging materials, such as wire ties, hard plastic "clamshell" casings or plastic bindings. It also eliminates traditional Color printing, replacing it with recyclable corrugated material. It's designed to be opened without the use of a box cutter or knife and will protect your product just as well as traditional packaging during shipping. This item ships in its own box, without the need for an additional shipping box.
feature_bullets: Colorful instruments and buttons activate a variety of 70+ songs, tunes, and learning responses
Introduces numbers, letters, shapes, colors and more
Explore sounds, songs and instruments such as the piano and drum
Includes classic children's tunes such as "old MacDonald" and "Itsy Bitsy spider."
The educator approved learning toy is designed by Leapfrog learning experts for ages 6-36 months. Ships in Certified Frustration-Free packaging

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
